sentences: Tal on mitu onu ja mitu tädi ning palju nõbusid.
Isa poolt, ema poolt nõod, nõbude lapsed.
context: The Estonian word 'nõbu' means cousin in English. It refers to the child of one's aunt or uncle. The word has different grammatical forms: nominative singular is 'nõbu', genitive singular is 'nõo', and partitive singular is also 'nõbu'. In plural form, it becomes 'nõod' (nominative), 'nõbude' (genitive), and 'nõbusid' (partitive). The word is commonly used to describe family relationships in Estonian.
